span.span: Governor Pritzker's Stay-at-Home order for mandatory closure of all Illinois schools and school activities have been extended through the end of the school year.
District 6 will continue to provide updated information as available.

img.alt: SixCast Logo with number 6 and sound waves
img.title: SixCast Logo with number 6 and sound waves

div.div: Don't forget to register for the 2020 Census to ensure that our state population accurately reflects our needs.
VIEW MORE About Be Counted in the 2020 Census

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled Northern Illinois Food Bank (NIFB)

div.div: The students and families in District 6 are extremely appreciative of the efforts of the Northern Illinois Food Bank (NIFB) and have awarded NIFB the Community Partnership Award.
VIEW MORE About Northern Illinois Food Bank (NIFB)
Future teachers from the College of Lake County visited District 6 this morning.
VIEW MORE About Future Teachers Visit District 6
Congratulations to our District 6 Bands and Orchestras who performed in their winter concerts this week.
VIEW MORE About Band and Orchestra Concerts
District 6 students may have had the day off...but our staff and teachers have been learning all day at our All-Staff Institute!
VIEW MORE About All-Staff Institute Day

img.alt: Teachers working in professional development sessions

div.div: Our teachers have been hard at working participating in #ZDAcademy Professional Development sessions.

a.title: TRIO Educational Talent Search Scholars Program

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled TRIO Educational Talent Search Scholars Program

div.div: TRIO Educational Talent Search Scholars Program

The TRIO Educational Talent Search Scholars Program was recognized at the Zion Elementary District 6 Board Meeting on February 24th. The TRIO program has been instrumental in helping to ensure the success of the teens in our District.
VIEW MORE About TRIO Educational Talent Search Scholars Program

Last evening, members of our community came together for the BPAC-PAC Valentine's Day Event and Father Daughter Dance at Zion Central Middle School. There were raffles and prizes, food and drinks, a dance, and even a presentation by the Dean of College of Lake County Lakeshore Campus, Jesus Ruiz. Fun was had by all! Thank you to everyone who came out last night to help make this event a huge success.
VIEW MORE About BPAC-PAC Valentine's Day Event

img.alt: Spelling bee winners, Carlos and James

div.div: Congratulations to our District 6 spellers on their participation in the ZEA District Spelling Bee!
VIEW MORE About ZEA District Spelling Bee

Fire Chief John Lewis and members of the Zion Fire Department were recognized at the Zion Elementary District 6 Board Meeting on January 27th. Not only does the Zion Fire Department support our schools with fire drill support and fire safety presentations, but they extend even further to help us with the execution of District events, and much more. We are thankful for the partnership that has been created, and look forward to its continued growth.
VIEW MORE About Zion Fire Department

D6INFO...Your Questions, Our Answers! Welcome to D6info, our Q&A information portal.
Seeking answers to questions? Please view our portal for previously asked questions. Don't see answers to your questions? Please email d6info@zion6.org.
